projects.title: Tartar-iflette
projects.bodyText:
- Procedural Rogue Like, Dungeon Crawler.
- You play as a boy who need to survive In Tartarus.
- Usage of 3 algorithms to generate procedural levels.
- Implementation of a "rogue like" upgrade mecanism

projects.title: Boïd Algorithm
projects.bodyText:
- Small project demonstrating various Boïd behaviors based on adjustable parameters.
- Control a submarine navigating among fish (Boïds), where you can visualize and modify their behaviors.

projects.title: Game Dev Party - NECC Vaulx-en-Velin
projects.bodyText:
- You have a gun loaded with rounds, each color-coded to match a specific enemy type.
- Your task : shoot all your neon bullets at their corresponding enemies.
- But watch out for the abyssal bullet!

projects.title: Ray Tracing in C++
projects.bodyText:
- First implementation of a Ray Tracing Algorithm.
- Implementation of other notions like BVH (Bounding Volume Hierarchy), rasterisation and Monte Carlos algorithm.

projects.title: Dijkstra & A* Algorithm
projects.bodyText:
- Small project showcasing the limitation and the differences between Dijkstra & A*.
- You design a maze in which a red cube will navigate to find its way to reach the green seed.

projects.title: Project Echoes
projects.bodyText:
- Procedural platformer game. (Mario Like)
- The game goal is to adapt the procedural generation on player performance.
- Project made with the Etudiant Entrepreneur title.

projects.title: Shooter Game
projects.bodyText:
- FPS Game made with OpenGL.
- As a first OpenGL project I learned a lot about specific tools used by it. (VAO, VBO, fragment shader ...)

projects.title: MultiPong
projects.bodyText:
- Pong Game made using SDL.
- Pushed the understanding of SDL further.
- Learnt a more formal and clean way to code a C++ Project

projects.title: PacMan
projects.bodyText:
- Small 24h project to learn new things about game development and put me under pressure.
- Learnt the bases of ECS architecture.
- First Utilisation of SDL as graphical library.

projects.title: Shogi 3D
projects.bodyText:
- Learn in depth mechanism of Unity by porting a known project in it.
- Push back the limitation of Shogi2D by changing game engine.
- Learnt a new language of programmation and it's concepts associated. (C#)

projects.title: Shogi 2D
projects.bodyText:
- Realisation of a boardgame in a new contexte of programmation.
- First Solo project that gave me a lot of confidence for my futur works.
- Developping Algorithms to move the pieces and detect the end of a game.

projects.title: Gotta Catch Em All - Créanimals
projects.bodyText:
- Setup of a website where you could register yourself and pull animals.
- Seeing all your animals and their rariry in an inventory.
- Possibility to place them in a garden and see them move.

projects.title: Code Game Jam 2022
projects.bodyText:
- Contemplative game where you go to the bottom of the ocean and discover it's biodiversity.
- Management of the electricity and the oxygen needed by the submarin with multiple elements. (torpedo, algae ...)

projects.title: Plavier
projects.bodyText:
- Help children with writing and association (letter -> shape) difficulty.
- Letters spawn at the top of the screen and move in the direction of a virtual keyboard.
- When the letter aligns with its corresponding key, the player must press that key to validate the action.
